posts.post_content:
I'm happy they reprinted this... It's not really a competitive way to win, but in a casual game it can be hilarious if your opponent has 60 health and a whole bunch of uber creatures and you're down to like 2.  
  
And hey, if for some reason I can't activate the door, I could just throw out Progenitus with all that mana or something.

Posted By: Kaleidostorm (7/13/2012 1:04:20 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card is both funny, stupid, lame and awesome all rolled into one!  
  
The whole "target player loses the game" cracks me up every time I read it. The mana cost is just so rediculous the card is usually dismissed.  
  
It enters the battlefield tapped, so opponents have ONE TURN to get rid of it, assuming you have the mana. Only an imbicile would play it early and leave it just sitting there because as soon as your opponent sees you've almost got that last mana, he will burn it. Play it AFTER you have it so he is like OH NOES!  
  
And if you have ![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol), you deserve to win the game. Actually no, you don't win, your opponent LOSES!!!! Talk about "*YOU LOSE*"....  
  
Nothing like this card in the Metallic Dreams Planeschase deck in multiplayer when you do actually have the mana. The feeling of power being able to choose someone's fate with one move is priceless, and so is the feeling of having everybody beg for their lives. "Who shall I end today"? Mind you, out of th... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: CorkBulb (7/15/2012 2:57:23 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This + [Chromatic Lantern](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chromatic Lantern) + mono-green land ramp? [Gatekeeper Vine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gatekeeper Vine), [Axebane Guardian](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Axebane Guardian), and [Fog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fog) for defense and ramp. Throw in [Farseek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Farseek) and the shock lands. [Worldspine Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Worldspine Wurm) as an alternate wincon to use all that ramp. If you can ramp to 10 lands for the door then what's one more for the Wurm? Maybe even [Craterhoof Behemoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Craterhoof Behemoth).  
  
Splash black for removal or white for chumps, protection, and life-gain?  
  
I bet first time through a tournament the deck could eat people alive simply because no one would expect it.
posts.html:
This + Chromatic Lantern + mono-green land ramp? Gatekeeper Vine, Axebane Guardian, and Fog for defense and ramp. Throw in Farseek and the shock lands. Worldspine Wurm as an alternate wincon to use all that ramp. If you can ramp to 10 lands for the door then what's one more for the Wurm? Maybe even Craterhoof Behemoth.

Splash black for removal or white for chumps, protection, and life-gain?

I bet first time through a tournament the deck could eat people alive simply because no one would expect it.

posts.post_content:
Did it really have to come into play tapped? ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) to use this right away, much harder then [Emrakul, the Aeons Torn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul, the Aeons Torn) and hardcasting him will have the same effect. Not to mention that this can still be countered.  
  
[Boundless Realms](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boundless Realms) was made for this, ive won with it 1v1 STD verse a decent deck. Just bummed that I couldn't do it in 1 turn, I had 15 mana.  
  
Its funny when you cast x2 Boundless Realms and get every land in your deck into play.
